fields.headline: The prize quiz
fields.bodyText: Our quizmaster this week is Bafta award-winning comedian Lee Mack. After recently appearing alongside Frasier's Kelsey Grammer in the US version of The Sketch Show, Lee is back in Britain and looking forward to meeting normal people with dirty teeth while on his national tour. Lee is also starring in his own Radio 2 variety show to be shown on Thursday night/Saturday afternoons in March. For tour details visit www.leemacklive.com Each week, a different guest quizmaster sets five questions per day, Monday to Friday. Send us answers to all 25 questions at the end of the week and the first correct entry out of the hat wins a Borders £100 electronic gift card (www.bordersstores.co.uk). D1 In terms of the actual population, which is the largest Spanish-speaking country in the world? a) Brazil b) Spain c) Argentina d) Mexico D2 Which of the following stations doesn't appear on a Monopoly board? a) Fenchurch Street b) Liverpool Street c) King's Cross d) Euston D3 Who's autobiography is entitled The Moon's a Balloon? a) Richard Branson b) Neil Armstrong c) David Niven d) Salvadore Dali D4 What's the perfect score in a game of 10-pin bowling? a) 100 b) 200 c) 300 d) 400 D5 In cockney rhyming slang, what is a pony worth? a) £20 b) £25 c) £30 d) £500
